title: Nvidia Is Now on Track to Surpass Alphabet's Market Cap
text: LIVE COVERAGE | CONCLUDED Last Updated: Feb. 14, 2024 at 7:49 PM EST 1 month ago By Connor Smith Nvidia on Wednesday was on track to close with a larger market capitalization than Alphabet for the first time on record. Shares of the chip maker were up 2.5% to $737.86 in Wednesday's session. That would bring its market cap to $1.83 trillion. Alphabet's market cap was sitting at $1.82 trillion, with the stock up just 0.2%. Nvidia surpassed Amazon.com in market cap at Tuesday's close. A rush to invest in artificial intelligence has created huge demand for Nvidia's advanced chips. It's also had Wall Street clamoring for Nvidia stock. Nvidia shares are up 1,777% in the past five years and 221% in the past 12 months. Nvidia would be the third-largest U.S. company by market cap if it usurps the Google parent company. NVIDIA Corp. NVDA (U.S.: Nasdaq) Alphabet Inc. Cl A GOOGL (U.S.: Nasdaq) Amazon.com Inc. AMZN (U.S.: Nasdaq) Advertisement - Scroll to Continue
